III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 made Youth A uncomfortable by staring at her while she
was undressing.
Investigation The Chief Administrator confirmed on 04/05/2024 that Youth A
was no longer placed at the facility and had been returned home
to the custody of her father on 03/20/2024.
DHHS Worker 1 confirmed on 04/08/2024 through contact with
Youth A’s Parent that Youth A had been returned to his custody in
late March and subsequently ran away from his home. At that
time, he was not aware of her location and had not had contact
with her.
The Complainant was contacted 04/08/2024 and 04/30/2024 but
contact was not returned as of the completion of this investigation.
Youth A’s Parent was interviewed over the phone on 04/30/2024.
He stated his daughter had returned home recently and was
subsequently detained and placed back at the facility. Youth A’s
Parent stated he had never heard his daughter mention anything
of concern that had happened at the facility when she was
previously placed, specifically that she never stated a staff
member watched her change clothes. He stated he did not have
any concerns himself about the facility.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone on 05/01/2024 with
DHHS Worker 1. Youth A denied ever being touched
inappropriately by any staff during either of her placements at the
facility. She stated there had been occasions that male staff had
to come into her room to communicate with her, but nothing
2

inappropriate occurred. Youth A denied there were any times that
she felt like she was watched while undressing in her room.
Staff 1 was interviewed over video on 05/01/2024 with DHHS
Worker 1. He denied ever touching Youth A or watching her
undress during her time placed at the facility. He recalled one
specific instance when he interacted with Youth A during her
previous placement in March 2024. Staff 1 stated Youth A was
already inside of her room and was agitated while getting ready
for a shower. Staff 1 stated he went to the window to talk to her
and recalled that she was fully clothed. He stated this interaction
did not last more than a few seconds. Staff 1 recalled that Staff 2
was present in the unit at that time as well. Staff 1 stated he
never went inside of Youth A’s room during her placements at the
facility. Staff 1 stated his training for interactions like this
consisted of knocking on the outside of a youth’s door and asking
if they were decent before lifting the flap that covered the outside
of the door window that provides privacy to the youth in their
room.
Staff 2 was interviewed over video on 05/15/2024 with DHHS
Worker 1. He recalled the date when Staff 1 was present in the
unit with him and checked on Youth A while in her room. Staff 2
denied seeing anything inappropriate occur between Staff 1 and
Youth A.
Documents reviewed:
• Staff 1 did not have any discipline in his personnel file.
• Email communication with the Chief Administrator on
04/19/2024 confirmed that a safety plan would be put into
place if Youth A were to be placed back at the facility,
ensuring that Staff 1 and Youth A had no contact with each
other.
Video Review:
• Video documentation from 03/18/2024 was provided. In
the footage Staff 1 could be seen approaching the room
where Youth A was located. Staff 1 lifted the privacy flap
briefly at 8:15:54 pm, and then lifted it again for
approximately three seconds. He then walked down the
stairwell from the upper floor of the unit. No other
interaction between Staff 1 and Youth A was witnessed.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documentation reviewed, there was no evidence to
show that Staff 1 watched Youth A changing her clothes.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
